description:
Manual games allow you to set custom check locations and custom item names that will be rolled into a multiworld.
This allows any variety of game -- PC, console, board games, Microsoft Word memes... really anything -- to be part of a multiworld randomizer.
The key component to including these games is some level of manual restriction. Since the items are not actually withheld from the player,
the player must manually refrain from using these gathered items until the tracker shows that they have been acquired or sent.

v1.0.0.description:
This is the latest release on discord but first version on Github. Everything included up until this point:
+ Checks Include:
Every Ending
Every Achievement
And most importantly of all, rejecting the Tan crewmate
plus some extra stuff

+ Received Items Include:
Progressive Game Accesses
Starting Options for Each Game (With Exceptions)
Certain Items Needed for Endings (Teleporter Access, Phone Number Accesses in FtC, Evidence Pieces in EtP, Etc.)
Accesses to have the ability to look at the Bio Book for each game
The Right Mouse Button (Can't get Bios without that!)
Some Self-Imposed Traps
And Ending Access for Completing the Mission from ItA & FtC

+ Goals:
All Endings!
Multiverse Corrected!
All Bios!

+ Meant for a new save file.

Feel free to give me any and all feedback you have!

91 Checks you can get (Excludes the Goals)
47 Items you can receive (Would prefer more, ideas welcome)
Filler name: Fail

Manual Tracker Highly Recommended

YAML Template Attached
v1.0.0.title: APManual_THSC v1.0.0

v1.0.1.description:
This release fixes a logic bug that could lead to impossible seeds, I also cleaned up the categories significantly.
+ Removed the Prog (EtP), Prog (StD), etc. categories from the received items list since they looked messy.
They were originally implemented to test a feature I never tried before and I never really used it so there wasn't much of a point in keeping them.
+ Fleeing The Complex Logic Fix
I overlooked implementing the logic needed for the ItA endings that connect to the call section in the Wait for a Transfer option.
+ Added a separate category for traps so that they are easier to see when you get them.
v1.0.1.title: APManual_THSC v1.0.1

v1.0.2.description:
Release fixes a small logic bug.
+ Fixed bug that caused the Rise N' Shine check to be in logic even though the Government Phone Number was not received yet, this check now requires said item.
v1.0.2.title: APManual_THSC v1.0.2

v1.0.3.description:
This release fixes a typo with an ending and adds a new goal!
+ Fixed a typo with the "Government Supported Private Investigator" ending check where it used to be listed as "Government Support Private Investigator"
+ A new goal has been added! "Any Completing the Mission Ending!" is a new goal where you only have to complete one of the Completing the Mission endings in order to complete the goal. This one is by far the shortest goal so if you want a quicker game but still wanna play Stickmin then this is a good compromise.
v1.0.3.title: APManual_THSC v1.0.3
